metadata.title: Usefulness of Published PCR Primers in Detecting Human Rhinovirus Infection

abstract.original_text: We conducted a preliminary comparison of the relative sensitivity of a cross-section of published human rhinovirus (HRV)-specifi c PCR primer pairs, varying the oligonucleotides and annealing temperature. None of the pairs could detect all HRVs in 2 panels of genotyped clinical specimens; >1 PCR is required for accurate description of HRV epidemiology.

sentences.segment_text: We conducted a preliminary comparison of the relative sensitivity of a cross-section of published human rhinovirus ( HRV ) - specifi c PCR primer pairs ,
varying the oligonucleotides and annealing temperature .
None of the pairs could detect all HRVs in 2 panels of genotyped clinical specimens ; > 1 PCR is required for accurate description of HRV epidemiology .
